This was that, and this was that alone, so far as in the Scripture it is revealed, in whichAuto-modernized they came short of that glory which is now enjoyed in heaven. And in thisAuto-modernized consists the advantage of the saints above them, who now die in faith. Their state in heaven was suited toAuto-modernized their faith and worship on the earth. They had no clear, distinct knowledge of the incarnation and mediatory office of Christ by their revelations and services; only they believed that the promise of deliverance, of grace and mercy, should be in and by him accomplished. Their reception into heaven -- that which they were made meet and prepared for by their faith and worship -- was suited to thatAuto-modernized. They had a blessed rest and happiness, above what we can comprehend; for who knows what it is to be in the glorious presence of God, though at the greatest distance? They were not immediately surprised with an appearance of that glory which they had no distinct apprehensions of in this world. Neither they nor the angels knew clearly either the sufferings of Christ or the glory that should ensue. But they saw and knew that there was yet something farther to be done in heaven and earth, as yet hid in God and the counsels of his will, for the exaltation of his glory in the complete salvation of the church. This they continued waiting for in the holy place of their refreshment above. Faith gave them, and it gives us, an entrance into the presence of God, and makes us meet for it. But what they immediately enjoyed did not in its whole kind exceed what their faith directed toAuto-modernized. No more doesAuto-modernized ours. ThereforeAuto-modernized they were not prepared for a view of the present glory of heaven; nor did enjoy it. But the saints under the New Testament, who are clearly instructed by the Gospel in the mysteries of the incarnation and mediation of Christ, are, by their faith and worship, made meet for an immediate entrance into this glory. This they long for, this they expect and are secured of, from the prayer of our Saviour, -- that they be, when they leave this world, where he is, to behold his glory.

But now, upon the entrance of Christ into the heavenly sanctuary, all those holy ones were admitted into the same glory with what the saints under the New Testament do enjoy. Upon thisAuto-modernized with open face they behold the use and end of those typical services and ordinances in whichAuto-modernized these things were shadowed out toAuto-modernized them. No heart can conceive that ineffable addition of glory which they received hereby. The mystery of the wisdom and grace of God in their redemption and salvation by Christ was now fully represented toAuto-modernized them; what they had prayed for, longed for, and desired to see in the days of their flesh on the earth, and waited for so long in heaven, was now gloriously made manifest toAuto-modernized them. Upon thisAuto-modernized did glorious light and blessed satisfaction come into and upon all those blessed souls, who died in the faith, but had not received the promise, -- only beheld it afar off. And hereby did God greatly manifest his own glory in them and toAuto-modernized them; which is the first end of the continuation of this state of things in heaven. This makes me judge that the season of Christ's entrance into heaven, as the holy sanctuary of God, was the greatest instance of created glory that ever was or ever shall be, toAuto-modernized the consummation of all things. And this as for other reasons, so because all the holy souls who had departed in the faith from the foundation of the world, were then received into the glorious light of the counsels of God, and knowledge of the effects of his grace by Jesus Christ.

Want of a due apprehension of the truth in thisAuto-modernized hasAuto-modernized caused many, especially those of the Church of Rome, to follow after vain imaginations about the state of the souls of the faithful, departed under the Old Testament. Generally, they shut them up in a subterranean limbus, from whereAuto-modernized they were delivered by the descent of Christ. But it is contrary toAuto-modernized all notions and revelations of the respect of God toAuto-modernized his people -- contrary to the life and nature of faith -- that those who have passed through their course of obedience in this world, and finished the work given toAuto-modernized them, should not enter, upon their departure, into blessed rest in the presence of God. Take away the persuasion of thisAuto-modernized, and the whole nature of faith is destroyed. But into the fulness of present glory they could not be admitted; as hasAuto-modernized been declared.

Moreover, God hereby manifests his glory toAuto-modernized the holy angels themselves. Those things in whichAuto-modernized it doesAuto-modernized consist were hid in himself even from them, from the foundation of the world, -- hidden in the holy counsels of his will, Ephesians 3:9 ThereforeAuto-modernized toAuto-modernized these "principalities and powers in heavenly places the manifold wisdom of God was made known by the church," verse 10. The church being redeemed by the blood of Christ, and himself upon thatAuto-modernized exalted in this glory, they came to know the "manifold wisdom of God" by the effects of it; which before they earnestly desired to look into, 1 Peter 1:12 Hereby is all the glory of the counsels of God in Christ made conspicuous toAuto-modernized them; and they receive themselves no small advancement in glory thereby. For in the present comprehension of the mind of God, and doing of his will, doesAuto-modernized their blessedness consist.

Heaven itself was not what it is, before the entrance of Christ into the sanctuary for the administration of his office. Neither the saints departed nor the angels themselves were participant of that glory which now they are. Neither yet doesAuto-modernized this argue any defect in heaven, or the state of thatAuto-modernized in its primitive constitution; for the perfection of any state hasAuto-modernized respect toAuto-modernized that order of things which it is originally suited toAuto-modernized. Take all things in the order of the first creation, and with respect to thatAuto-modernized heaven was perfect in glory from the beginning. NeverthelessAuto-modernized there was still a relation and regard in it toAuto-modernized the church of mankind on the earth, which was to be translated thither. But by the entrance of sin all this order was disturbed, and all this relation was broken. And there followed upon thatAuto-modernized an imperfection in the state of heaven itself; for it had no longer a relation toAuto-modernized, or communion with, them on earth, nor was a receptacle meet for men who were sinners to be received into. ThereforeAuto-modernized, by the "blood of the cross," God "reconciled all things toAuto-modernized himself, whether they be things in earth, or things in heaven," Colossians 1:20, -- or gathered all things into one in him, "both which are in heaven, and which are on earth," Ephesians 1:10 Even the things in heaven so far stood in need of a reconciliation, as that they might be gathered together in one with the things on earth; the glory of whichAuto-modernized is manifested in this heavenly ministration. And the apostle affirms that the "heavenly things themselves" were purified by the sacrifice of Christ, Hebrews 9:23 Not that they were actually defiled in themselves, but without this purification they were not meet for the fellowship of this mystery in the joint worship of the whole society in heaven and earth, by Jesus Christ. Hence, therefore, there is a continual manifestation of the glory of God toAuto-modernized the angels themselves. They behold his manifold wisdom and grace in the blessed effects of it, which were treasured up in the holy counsels of his will from eternity. Hereby is their own light and blessedness advanced, and they are filled with admiration of God, ascribing praise, honour, and glory toAuto-modernized him for evermore; for the beholding of the mystery of the wisdom of God in Christ, which is here so despised in the dispensation of the Gospel, is the principal part of the blessedness of the angels in heaven, which fills them with eternal delight, and is the ground of their ascribing praise and glory toAuto-modernized him for evermore.

This is that manifestative glory with whichAuto-modernized God satisfiesAuto-modernized himself, until the end determined shall be. On the account of thisAuto-modernized he doesAuto-modernized and will bear with things in this world, toAuto-modernized the appointed season. For whilst the creation is in its present posture, a revenue of glory must be taken out of it for God; and longer than that is done it cannot be continued. But the world is so full of darkness and confusion, of sin and wickedness, of enmity against God, -- is so given up to villany, toAuto-modernized all the ways through whichAuto-modernized God may be dishonoured, -- that there is little or no appearance of any revenue of glory toAuto-modernized him from it. Were it not on the secret account of divine wisdom, it would quickly receive the end of Sodom and Gomorrah. The small remnant of the inheritance of Christ is shut up in such obscurity, that, as toAuto-modernized visible appearance and manifestation, it is no way to be laid in the balance against the dishonour that is done toAuto-modernized him by the whole world. But whilst things are in this posture here below, God hasAuto-modernized a solemn honour, glory, and worship above, in the presence of all his holy ones; in whichAuto-modernized he restsAuto-modernized and takes pleasure. In his satisfaction in thisAuto-modernized he will continue things in this world toAuto-modernized all the ends of his wisdom, goodness, righteousness, and patience, let it rage in villainy and wickedness as it pleasesAuto-modernized. And so, when any of the saints who are wearied, and even worn out, with the state of things in this world, and, it may be, understand not the grounds of the patience of God, do enter into this state, they shall, toAuto-modernized their full satisfaction, behold that glory which abundantly compensates the present dishonour done to God here below.

(2.) This state of things is continued for the glory of Christ himself. The office of Mediator was committed by God the Father toAuto-modernized his only-begotten Son, -- no other being able to bear or discharge it. See Isaiah 9:6; Revelation of John 5:1-5 But in the discharge of this office it was necessary he should condescend toAuto-modernized a mean and low condition, and to undergo things difficult, hard, and terrible, Philippians 2:6-8 Such were the things which our Lord Jesus Christ underwent in this world; -- his undergoing of them being necessary toAuto-modernized the discharge of his office; yea, it consisted in thatAuto-modernized. In thisAuto-modernized was he exposed toAuto-modernized reproach, contempt, and shame, with all the evils that Satan or the world could bring upon him. And besides, he was, for us and in our stead, to undergo the "curse of the law," with the greatest of terror and sorrows in his soul, until he gave up the ghost. These things were necessary toAuto-modernized the discharge of his office, nor could the salvation of the church be wrought out without them. But do we think that God would commit so glorious an office toAuto-modernized his only Son to be discharged in this manner only? Let it be granted that after he had so accomplished the will of God in this world, he had himself entered into glory; yet if he should so cease the administration of his office, that must be looked on as the most afflictive and dolorous that ever was undergone. But it was the design of God to glorify the office itself; as an effect of his wisdom, and himself in thatAuto-modernized; yea, so as that the very office itself should be an everlasting honour to his Son as incarnate. ToAuto-modernized this end the administration of it is continued in glory in his hand, and he is exalted in the discharge of it. For this is that glory which he prays that all his disciples may be brought toAuto-modernized him to behold. The time between his ascension and the end of all things is allotted toAuto-modernized the glory of Christ in the administration of his office in the heavenly sanctuary. And from hence doesAuto-modernized the apostle prove him, "as a high priest," to be far more glorious than those who were called toAuto-modernized that office under the law, Hebrews 8:1-3 In thisAuto-modernized it is manifest toAuto-modernized angels and men, how glorious a thing it is to be the only king, priest, and prophet of the church. ThereforeAuto-modernized, as it behoved Christ, in the discharge of his office, to suffer; so, after his sufferings in the discharge of the same office, he was to enter into his glory, Revelation of John 1:18

(3.) God hasAuto-modernized respect in thisAuto-modernized toAuto-modernized those who depart in the faith, in their respective generations, especially those who died betimes, as the apostles and primitive Christians. And sundry things may be in thisAuto-modernized considered.

[1.] There are two things which believers put a great price and value on in this world, and which sweeten every condition toAuto-modernized them. Without them the world would be a noisome dungeon toAuto-modernized them, nor could they be satisfied with a continuance in thatAuto-modernized. The one is the service of Christ. Without an opportunity of being exercised in thisAuto-modernized, they could not abide here with any satisfaction. They who know it not so to be, are under the power of worldly-mindedness. The meanest service of Christ hasAuto-modernized refreshment in it. And as to those who have opportunities and abilities for great instances of service, they do not know on just grounds, nor are able to determine themselves, whether it be best for them to continue in their service here below, or to enter into the immediate service of Christ above; -- so glorious, so excellent is it to be usefully serviceable toAuto-modernized the Lord Jesus. So was it with the apostle, Philippians 1:21-26; -- so may it be with others, if they serve him in the same spirit, with the same sincerity, though their ability in service be not like toAuto-modernized his. For neither had he anything but what he received. Again, they have the enjoyment of Christ in the ordinances of Gospel worship. By these means do they live, -- in these things is the life of their souls.

In this state of things God will not call them hence toAuto-modernized their loss; he will not put an end toAuto-modernized these privileges, without an abundant recompense and advantage. Whatever we enjoy here, yet still to depart hence and to be with Christ shall be far better, Philippians 1:23 For, --

1^st, although service here below shall cease, and be given over toAuto-modernized other hands who are to have their share in thisAuto-modernized; yet, on the continuance of this state of things in heaven, there is also a continuation of service toAuto-modernized Christ, in a way inexpressibly more glorious than what we are in this life capable of. Upon their admittance into this state of things above, they are before the throne of God, and serve him day and night in his temple; and he that sitsAuto-modernized on the throne shall dwell among them, Revelation of John 7:15 The whole state of the glorious worship of God before described is here respected; and in thisAuto-modernized is a continual service performed toAuto-modernized him that sits on the throne, and toAuto-modernized the Lamb. ThereforeAuto-modernized it is so far from being loss, in being called off from service here below, as that, in point of service itself, it is an inconceivable advancement.

2^dly, The enjoyment of Christ in and by the ordinances of his worship, is the immediate fountain and spring of all our refreshments and consolations in this world, Psalms 87:7; but what is it toAuto-modernized the blessed immediate enjoyment of him in heaven! Hence the blessedness of the state above is described, by being with Christ, being with Christ for ever, -- in the presence and immediate enjoyment of him. The light of the stars is useful and relieving in a dark night as we are on our way; but what are they when the sun arisesAuto-modernized! Will any man think it a loss that, upon the rising of the sun, they shall not enjoy their light any more, though in the night they knew not what to have done without it? It may be we cannot conceive how it will be best for us to forego the use of sacraments, ministry, and the Scripture itself. But all the virtue of the streams is in the fountain; and the immediate enjoyment of Christ unspeakably exceeds whatever by any means we can be made partakers of here below.

In this blessed state have the holy apostles, all the primitive martyrs and believers, from the time of their dissolution, enjoyed full satisfaction and solace, in the glorious assembly above, Revelation of John 7:15-17, etc..

[2.] Hereby there is a continuation of communion between the church triumphant above and that yet militant here below. That there is such a communion between glorified saints and believers in this world, is an article of faith. Both societies are but one church, one mystical body, have one Head, and a mutual concernAuto-modernized in each other. Yea, the spring and means of this communion is no small part of the glory of the Gospel. For, -- before the saints under the Old Testament had the mystery of the glory of God in Christ, with our redemption thereby, revealed toAuto-modernized them, in the way before declared, -- the communion was very obscure; but we are now taken into the light and glory of it, as the apostle declares, Hebrews 12:22-24

I know some have perverted the notions of the communion toAuto-modernized idolatrous superstition; and so have all other truths of the Gospel been abused and wrested, toAuto-modernized the destruction of the souls of men; -- all the Scriptures have been so dealt withal, 2 Peter 3:16 But they deceived themselves in this matter, -- the truth deceivesAuto-modernized none. Upon a supposition of communion, they gathered that there must of necessity be an immediate communication between them above and us below. And if so, they knew no way for it, no means of it, but by our praying toAuto-modernized them, and their praying for us. But they were under the power of their own deceivings. Communion doesAuto-modernized not require immediate mutual communication, unless it be among persons in the same state, and that in such acts as in whichAuto-modernized they are mutually assisting and helpful toAuto-modernized one another. But our different states will admit of no such intercourse; nor do we stand in need of any relief from them, or can be helped by any acts of their love, as we may aid and help one another here below. ThereforeAuto-modernized the centre of this communion is in Christ alone and our exercise of it is upon him only, with respect toAuto-modernized them.

Yet upon thisAuto-modernized some deny that there is any such communion between the members of the church or the mystical body of Christ in these diverse states. And they suppose it is so declared in that of the prophet, Isaiah 63:16, "Doubtless thou art our Father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel acknowledge us not." But there is nothing of any such importance in these words. The church, under a deep sense of its present state, in its unworthy walking and multiplied provocations, profess themselves to be such, as that their forefathers in covenant could not own them as their children and posterity in the faith. Hereupon they appeal toAuto-modernized the infinite mercy and faithfulness of God, which extend themselves even toAuto-modernized that condition of unworthiness which was enough to render them utterly disowned by the best of men, however otherwise concerned in them. But to suppose the church above, which hasAuto-modernized passed through its course of faith and obedience in afflictions, tribulations, and persecutions, to be ignorant of the state of the church here below in general, and unconcerned in it, -- to be without desires of its success, deliverance, and prosperity, toAuto-modernized the glory of Christ, -- is to lay them asleep in a senseless state, without the exercise of any grace, or any interest in the glory of God. And if they cry for vengeance on the obdurate persecuting world, Revelation of John 6:10, shall we suppose they have no consideration nor knowledge of the state of the church suffering the same things which they did themselves? And, to put it out of question, they are minded of it in the next verse by Christ himself, verse 11.

But that which at present I alone intend, is the joint communion of the whole church in the worship of God in Christ. Were all that die in the Lord immediately received into that state in whichAuto-modernized God "shall be all in all," -- without any use of the mediation of Christ, or the worship of praise and honour given toAuto-modernized God by him, -- without being exercised in the ascription of honour, glory, power, and dominion toAuto-modernized him, on the account of the past and present discharge of his office, -- there could be no communion between them and us. But whilst they are in the sanctuary, in the temple of God, in the holy worship of Christ and of God in him, and we are not only employed in the same work, in sacred ordinances suited toAuto-modernized our state and condition, but, in the performance of our duties, do by faith "enter in within the veil," and approach toAuto-modernized the same throne of grace in the most holy place, there is a spiritual communion between them and us. So the apostle expressesAuto-modernized it, Hebrews 12:22-24

[3.] It is the way that God hasAuto-modernized appointed to prepare the holy souls above for the enjoyment of that eternal state which shall ensue at the end of all things. As we are here, in and by the Word and other ordinances, prepared and made meet for the present state of things in glory; so are they, by the temple-worship of heaven, fitted for that state of things when Christ shall give up the kingdom toAuto-modernized the Father, that God may be all in all.
(4.) Respect is had in thisAuto-modernized toAuto-modernized the faith of the church yet militant on the earth, and that, among others, in two things.

1^st, For the encouragement of their faith. God could, as we have observed, upon the supposition of the atonement and reconciliation made by the blood of Christ, have saved the church by mere sovereign act of power. But whereas it was toAuto-modernized his glory that we should be saved in the way of faith and obedience, this way was necessary toAuto-modernized our encouragement in thatAuto-modernized. For it is in the nature of faith, it is a grace suited toAuto-modernized that end, to seek for and receive aid, help, and relief, from God continually, to enable us toAuto-modernized obedience.

For this end the Lord Christ continuesAuto-modernized in the discharge of his office, through whichAuto-modernized he is able to save us toAuto-modernized the uttermost, that we may receive such supplies by and from him. The continual use that faith makes of Christ toAuto-modernized this purpose, as he gloriously exercisesAuto-modernized his mediatory office and power in heaven, cannot fully be declared. Neither can any believer, who is acted by present Gospel light and grace, conceive how the life of faith can be led or preserved without it. No duties are we called toAuto-modernized, -- no temptation are we exercised withal, -- no sufferings do we undergo, -- no difficulties, dangers, fears, have we to conflict withal, -- nothing is there in life or death, in whichAuto-modernized the glory of God or our own spiritual welfare is concerned, -- but faith finds and takes relief and encouragement in the present mediatory life and power of Christ in heaven, with the exercise of his love, care, and compassion in thatAuto-modernized. So he proposesAuto-modernized himself toAuto-modernized our faith, Revelation of John 1:17-18

2^dly, That our faith may be guided and directed in all our accesses toAuto-modernized God in his holy worship. Were nothing proposed toAuto-modernized us but the immensity of the divine essence, we should not know how to make our approaches toAuto-modernized it. And thence it is that those who are unacquainted with the glory of this dispensation, who know not how to make use of Christ in his present state for an access toAuto-modernized God, are always inventing ways of their own (as by saints, angels, images) for that end; for an immediate access toAuto-modernized the divine essence they cannot fancy. ThereforeAuto-modernized, to end this discourse in one word, -- all the present faith and worship of God in the church here on earth, all access toAuto-modernized him for grace, and all acceptable ascriptions of glory toAuto-modernized his divine majesty, do all of them, in their being and exercise, wholly depend on, and are resolved into, the continuation of the mediatory actings of Christ in heaven and glory.

I shall close this discourse with a little review of somewhat that passed before. From the consideration of that place of the apostle in whichAuto-modernized he affirms, that at the end Christ shall give up the kingdom toAuto-modernized the Father, I declared that all the state of things which we have described shall then cease, and all things issue in the immediate enjoyments of God himself. I would extend this no farther than as toAuto-modernized what concernsAuto-modernized the exercise of Christ's mediatory office with respect toAuto-modernized the church here below, and the enemies of it. But there are some things which belong toAuto-modernized the essence of this state which shall continue toAuto-modernized all eternity; as, --

1^st, I do believe that the person of Christ, in and by his human nature, shall be for ever the immediate head of the whole glorified creation. God having gathered all things toAuto-modernized a head in him, the knot or centre of that collection shall never be dissolved. We shall never lose our relation toAuto-modernized him, nor he his toAuto-modernized us.

2^dly, I do therefore also believe, that he shall be the means and way of communication between God and his glorified saints for ever. What are, what will be, the glorious communications of God toAuto-modernized his saints for ever, in life, light, power, joy, rest, and ineffable satisfaction, (as all must be from him toAuto-modernized eternity,) I shall not now inquire. But this I say, they shall be all made in and through the person of the Son, and the human nature in thatAuto-modernized. That tabernacle shall never be folded up, never be laid aside as useless. And if it be said, that I cannot declare the way and manner of the eternal communications of God himself toAuto-modernized his saints in glory by Christ; I shall only say, that I cannot declare the way and manner of his communications of himself in grace by Christ toAuto-modernized the souls of men in this world, and yet I do believe it. How much more must we satisfy ourselves with the evidence of faith alone in those things which, as yet, are more incomprehensible. And our adherence toAuto-modernized God, by love and delight, shall always be through Christ. For God will be conceived of toAuto-modernized eternity according to the manifestation that he hasAuto-modernized made of himself in him, and no otherwise. This shall not be by acting faith with respect toAuto-modernized the actual exercise of the mediation of Christ, as now we cleave toAuto-modernized God; but it shall be by the all-satisfying acting of love toAuto-modernized God, as he hasAuto-modernized manifested himself, and will manifest himself in Christ.

3^dly, The person of Christ, and in thatAuto-modernized his human nature, shall be the eternal object of divine glory, praise, and worship. The life of glory is not a mere state of contemplation. Vision is the principle of it, as faith is of the life of grace. Love is the great vital acting of that principle, in adherence toAuto-modernized God with eternal delight. But this is active in it also. It shall be exercised in the continual ascription and assignation of glory, praise, and honour toAuto-modernized God, and the glorious exercise of all sorts of grace in thatAuto-modernized; -- of thisAuto-modernized the Lamb, the person of Christ, is the eternal object with that of the Father and the Spirit; the human nature in the Son, admitted into the communion of the same eternal glory.
